infobox.Japanese title:: スマイルの里の陰謀  (Sumairu no Sato no Inbō)
infobox.Character design:: Masatomo Sudo  Masanori Hashimoto (sub-character)  Hiroshi Ogawa (design works)
infobox.Voice Cast::
Voice Cast:



Minami Takayama as Conan Edogawa  Yukiko Iwai as Ayumi Yoshida  Wataru Takagi as Genta Kojima  Ikue Otani as Mitsuhiko Tsuburaya  Chie Kojiro as Botan Hotaka  Kujira as Sumire Sumida  Tamao Hayashi as Sakura Sakuma  Chie Sato as Azami Azagami  Akihiro Tajima as Ondo Shibuzura  Takumi Yamazaki as Tango Hohoemi  Roko Takizawa as Waltz Hohoemi

sections.Situation: Conan and the Detective Boys are invited to "Smile Village" elderly facility. Suprisingly, the old women who live there are fans of the Detective Boys, and they are very rich. The Detective Boys then have suspicion on the owners.

sections.Trivia:
- Although this episode may seem somewhat absurd, it is actually an insinuation of social phenomena with outrageous plots: reflects eldery scam.
- In one of the interviews[1], director Yasuichiro Yamamoto disclosed many things about this episode:
He knew that every time Urasawa's script is being aired, it caused intense discussions, and he called Urasawa's script surrealism.
They followed almost everything Urasawa indicated in the original script, except the special way that Shibuzura walks.
The scenario where the table with the contract deposited got kicked away by Conan's football was actually the storyboard artist, Masaharu Okuwaki's idea.
He thinks that Urasawa's scripts can bring a sense of addiction particularly, and he would love to see his next "famous" work.
- He knew that every time Urasawa's script is being aired, it caused intense discussions, and he called Urasawa's script surrealism.

- He thinks that Urasawa's scripts can bring a sense of addiction particularly, and he would love to see his next "famous" work.
- Some character names are insipired from dances, like Tango (a romantic dance from Argentina), Waltz, and Ondo (a folklore japanese dance).
